intro: Zexmenia arnottii f. angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaved zexmenia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Myrtaceae. It is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves that are typically arranged alternately along the stems. The plant produces small, white or pale pink flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, adding to its ornamental value. It is native to Australia and thrives in well-drained soils in sunny to partially shaded environments. Due to its unique foliage and floral display, it is often cultivated in gardens for its aesthetic appeal.
